content: sl1 k3 turn work these 2 row 18 times or until desired heel flap length heel turn the heel turn begins on a ws row only mc is used row 1 ws sl1 p15 19 23 p2tog p1 turn row 2 rs sl1 k4 6 8 ssk k1 turn row 3 ws sl1 p until 1 st before gap p2tog p1 turn row 4 rs sl1 k until 1 st before gap ssk k1 turn repeat row 3 and 4 until all stitches have been used 17 21 25 stitches remain do not turn after the final row gusset setup with mc pick up and knit 19 stitches along the side of the heel flap or 1 stitch for every 2 heel flap row plus 1 in the corner to prevent a hole place bor marker here at the beginning of the instep work in pattern across the 31 37 43 instep sts this should be the second/even mc round of the mosaic pattern pick up and knit 19 stitches along the other side of the heel flap or the same number as the first side knit to bor there are now 31 37 43 instep sts and 55 59 63 gusset and sole sts for a total of 86 96 106 sts foot switch to cc if you did everything right it should be waiting for you here at the bor round 1 cc work instep sts according to the chart knit across sole sts round 2 decrease round cc work instep sts according to the chart k1 ssk k until 3 sts before bor k2tog k1 round 3 mc work instep sts according to the chart knit across sole sts round 4 decrease round mc work instep sts according to the chart k1 ssk k until 3 sts before bor k2tog k1 circuit socks v1 0 - cow from mars - 4 repeat until 62 74 86 total stitches remain stopping after a decrease round if you prefer a larger/smaller foot you may decrease to a larger/smaller stitch count - you ll just need to make some adjustments to the toe later on for the remainder of the foot continue as established working according to the chart on the instep and in stockinette on the sole continue alternating mc and cc every two rounds when you are ready to start the toe see calculation below end the pattern after row 2 or 14 for best results if that doesn t work out you can stop after finishing any 2 cc rounds although i think that s less preferable than to end the pattern a little bit earlier and add a few plain knit rounds before starting the toe to figure out when to start the toe know that the toe has 24 rounds divide by your stockinette row gauge and that is how long the toe will be for example my row gauge is 10 so my toe will measure 2 4 toe cut cc using mc knit
